chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant James W. St Clair was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No contact with J. McNatt unless specifically authorized by supervising agent. No contact with females under the age of 18 unless they are in the presence of a parent or guardian. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.

DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Defendant to complete Sex Offender Treatment as deemed appropriate by supervising agent. Defendant to establish and interest bearing account in his daughter's name and make $212 monthly payments to that account. Should the defendant be ordered to pay child support in the Douglas County family case with J. McNatt this order would be extinguished.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

Case called @ 2:46 p.m. Defendant James W St Clair in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by victim and the victim's mother. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Goldin. No statement by DE. Court orders: Ct 1 - S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: 4 mos WC Jail - Huber, No GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than 1/3/2016 - No objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction, DE to complete SOT as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, DE to establish and interest bearing account in his daughter's name and make payments of $212 monthly to that account - order to be extinguished if a support order is established in Douglas County, NC w/ J. McNatt unless specifically authorized by supervising agent, NC w/ females under the age of 18 unless in the presence of parent or guardian, DNA sample and surcharge, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Ct 2 - 2 years probation concurrent with Ct 1 - Conditions: Same as Ct 1 with the exception of jail time. No SOT registration ordered. Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant James W St Clair in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin. Atty Goldin appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Goldin requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
No contact with any females under the age of 18 yrs unless in the presence of a parent or guardian.     Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant James W St Clair in court, in person, with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive 20 Day time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  ADA argues as to Signature Bond of $2500.000.  Atty Goldin does not object to bond request.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:25 pm.
from Atty Goldin to Appear Telephonically for 7/28/2015 IA - Request granted by Court
